page.title: 01LITTLE PAXTON
page.content: { Little Paxton is to the East of the {A1 road} and to the West, is the Great River Ouse.The village church is of Anglo Saxon origin and the area was once part of a Saxon hundred. Remains of the Mammouth have been uncovered in the local gravel pits. Across the river Great Paxton stands high above the river and overlooks Little Paxton. The ferry between the two villages is nomore and the old ferry house was demolished quite recently.The family still live in Little Paxton. The Park which gives its name to many of the streets has been developed over the last fifteen years. The old gate house and the avenue of trees remain.The latter can be identified in the new houses gardens. The House that once hosted Jersey Lil, and later expectant mothers from
